meanings.sent1: I typewrite my school assignments to make them neat.
meanings.sent2: She likes to typewrite letters to her friends.
meanings.sent3: I tried to typewrite a love letter, but it came out all jumbled up!
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced on the keys as she typewrite her novel.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the typewriter filled the room as she continued to typewrite.

meanings.sent1: He learned to typewrite his reports for work.
meanings.sent2: They typewrite the scripts for the TV show every week.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally typewrite the wrong date on the document.
meanings.sent4: The typewriter seemed to typewrite on its own in the haunted house.
meanings.sent5: She had to typewrite the entire manuscript in one night to meet the deadline.

meanings.definition: A machine for writing mechanically in characters resembling print.
meanings.sent1: The old typewriter was still used in the antique shop.
meanings.sent2: She bought a vintage typewriter to add to her collection.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the typewriter and accidentally started to typewrite!
meanings.sent4: The typewriter sat in the corner, a relic of a bygone era when people used to typewrite everything.
meanings.sent5: The clacking sound of the typewriter was soothing as it continued to typewrite the novel.
